divs: Sighting DetailsI was house-sitting for a friend near Santa Fe, and when returning to the house one evening, I spotted a very bright, slow moving white light with multiple non-blinking red and green lights below the white light. The object was moving in a southwesterly direction (heading approx. 240 degrees). By the time I could get pulled over and get out my binoculars, the object was too far away to discern any particular shape. At first I thought it was a helicopter, but it was close enough that I would have heard it, and there was absolutely no sound. A helicopter passed to the north of this location at about twice the distance, and it could be heard quite clearly. After watching the object for about twenty minutes, I proceeded on to the house, and continued periodically watching the object for the next two hours. From this particular location, there is a good view between the nearby hills to the southwest, and the object seemed to be following the same course for the duration of the sighting. From what I could tell, it also maintained the same altitude throughout the viewing period. The view was eventually blocked by distant mountains. My reaction was, "Wow - I'm a field inestigator, and I finally got to see one for myself!" (Actually, it's not the first - just never one so close up).
Summary: Very large, bright white light moving slowly across the sky.
